intro: Phyllanthus betsileanus var. isalensis, commonly known as the Isalensis Phyllanthus, is a shrub native to Madagascar. It belongs to the Euphorbiaceae family and is characterized by its small, clustered leaves and yellow flowers. The plant typically grows in dry, rocky habitats and is adapted to arid conditions. It has a compact growth form with dense foliage, which helps it conserve moisture. Its botanical features make it a distinctive species within its native ecosystem.
